# 【0†Tokyo travel: Best and worst times to visit†www.newsbytesapp.com】
Each season in Tokyo presents a distinct experience, making the timing of visits crucial for travelers aiming to fully enjoy the city's diverse offerings. This unique blend of old and new makes Tokyo an unforgettable destination for all visitors.
# 【1†Japan to experience record heat, extreme temperatures on July 21†www.thestar.com.my】
TOKYO: Record-breaking heat is expected to hit Japan on Sunday (July 21), with over 200 locations across Japan forecast to experience extreme temperatures.
# 【2†Japan to experience record heat, extreme temperatures on Sunday†theshillongtimes.com】
Record-breaking heat is expected to hit Japan on Sunday, with over 200 locations across Japan forecasted to experience extreme temperatures. Scorching temperatures were recorded from Kanto to Okinawa on Saturday,
# 【3†Japan to experience record heat, extreme temperatures†www.chinaview.cn】
Shizuoka city was the hottest place in the country, recording 38.9 degrees Celcius, followed by Fuchu city in the Tokyo area at 38 degrees Celcius. The temperature reached 35.8 degrees Celcius in Tokyo, marking the first day of severe heat in nearly two weeks.

August, marked by an average high-temperature of 31°C (87.8°F) and a low-temperature of 25.1°C (77.2°F), is the warmest month in Tokyo. Heat index. # 【13†Best (and Worst) Times to Visit Tokyo in 2024 - Asia Highlights†www.asiahighlights.com】
August is the hottest month in Tokyo with an average daily high of about 31°C (88°F). The coldest month is January, with an average daily high of 10°C (50°F). The "plum rainy season" extends from June to mid-July and brings persistent light rain.
# 【14†Tokyo August Weather, Average Temperature (Japan) - Weather Spark†weatherspark.com】
For reference, on August 8, the hottest day of the year, temperatures in Tokyo typically range from 77°F to 87°F, while on January 26, the coldest day of the year, they range from 36°F to 48°F. Complete Guide to Visiting Japan in August 2024: Weather, What to See & Do. Last updated: 22 January 2021. Albeit quite hot, Japanese summer is absolutely gorgeous, colorful, and rich of events, festivals, and entertainment to complement the amazing sights. August is when the Japanese rainy season is over.
# 【16†Japan Weather in August 2024: Travel Tips for First Visit - Asia Highlights†www.asiahighlights.com】
Average daily temperatures peak at 88°F (31°C). As the rainy season (June to August) fades away, you would be rewarded with the driest weather of Japan's summer with just a few short downpours. Rainfall increases again in late August as the typhoon season (September to October) approaches.
# 【17†Tokyo, Weather for August, Japan - Holiday Weather†www.holiday-weather.com】
79 °F.
# 【18†[2024] Embracing Weather in Japan in August and Unveiling Summer's ...†www.trip.com】
In August, Tokyo experiences warm weather with average maximum temperatures reaching around 31°C (88°F) and average minimum temperatures hovering around 24°C (75°F). The city also receives an average precipitation of 170mm (6.7 inches) during this month.

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

Daytime temperatures usually reach 31°C in Tokyo in August with high heat and humidity, falling to 24°C at night. 

### How sunny is it in Tokyo in August?

There are normally 6 hours of bright sunshine each day in Tokyo in August - that's 43% of daylight hours. 

### How warm is the sea around Tokyo in August?

The average sea temperature around Tokyo in August is 26°C.

### Does it rain in Tokyo in August?

There are usually 16 days with some rain in Tokyo in August and the average monthly rainfall is 147mm. 

### What is the chance of a typhoon in Tokyo in August?

On average 1.8 days in August in Tokyo are likely to be affected by the passage of one or more tropical storms.

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the warmest month in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the peak temperatures are generally noted in August, averaging a high of 31°C (87.8°F) and a low of 25.1°C (77.2°F).

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

In Tokyo, 31°C (87.8°F) is the average high-temperature and 25.1°C (77.2°F) is the average low-temperature during August. The average heat index (a.k.a. 'feels like', 'real feel'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is appraised at 39°C (102.2°F).

### What is the average humidity in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the average relative humidity in August is 73%.

### How many days does it rain in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, it is raining for 9.7 days, with typically 26mm (1.02") of accumulated precipitation.

### When it does not snow in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, snow does not fall in April through December.

### What is the month with the warmest sea water in Tokyo?

August is the month with the warmest seawater in Tokyo, with an average sea temperature of 25.7°C (78.3°F).

### What is the water temperature in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, the average water temperature is 25.7°C (78.3°F). For swimming, diving, and other water activities, temperatures between 25°C (77°F) and 29°C (84.2°F) are perceived as very enjoyable and pleasurable for prolonged periods without feeling uncomfortable.

### What is the average length of the day in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average day length in August is 13h and 29min.

### When are sunrise and sunset in August in Tokyo?

In August, on the first day of the month, sunrise is at 04:49 and sunset at 18:45. On the last day of the month, in Tokyo, sunrise is at 05:12 and sunset at 18:10 JST.

### What month has the most sunshine in Tokyo?

With an average of 10.3h of sunshine, August has the most sunshine of the year in Tokyo, Japan.

### How many hours of sunshine does Tokyo have in August?

The average sunshine duration in August in Tokyo is 10.3h.

### What is the UV index reading in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average daily maximum UV index in August is 6. A UV Index value of 6 to 7 symbolizes a high health vulnerability from unsafe exposure to Sun's UV rays.

Festivals: August in Japan is the perfect time to experience culture-rich festival celebrations and grand fireworks displays. Don't miss the chance to immerse yourself in the huge parades, traditional dance performances, and colorful fireworks.

  * The Jingu Gaien Fireworks Festival in Tokyo (mid-August in 2024)
  * The Obon Festival in Kyoto (August 13 to 16, 2024)
  * The Yodogawa Fireworks Festival in Osaka (August 3, 2024)

Suggest reading: 【32†Plan a Family Trip to Japan 】>>>

【43† 】 

【43†9-Day Japan Highlights Tour Tokyo - Hakone - Kyoto - Osaka 】

## Hokkaido and Northern Japan in August: Summer Retreats

  * Sapporo, Otaru, and Noboribetsu

With its higher latitudes, you could enjoy cooler weather and more-bearable humidity in northern Japan than in central and southern Japan. The average high is 77°F (25°C).

In late August, Hokkaido receives its heaviest rainfall, averaging 5 in (127 mm) for the month. If you're looking for outdoor adventures, such as hiking in the national parks, early August should be a better time.

August is also the best time to spot wildlife from a sightseeing boat, such as brown bears, whales, and a variety of birds.

Festival: The Noboribetsu Hell Festival is held in Hell Valley (Jidokudai) on the last Saturday in August every year in Noboribetsu. You would see locals playing the drums and performing traditional dances in the grand parade.

Here are some popular travel lengths in Japan for your inspiration: 【44†7 days】, 【45†10 days】, 【46†12 days】, and 【47†14 days】.

【48† 】 

【48†8-Day Hokkaido Summer Vacation — Nature & Traditions】

## Okinawa in Southern Japan in August: Best for Water Sports

  * Naha

In August, average daily temperatures range from 81°F (27°C) to 88°F (31°C ) in Okinawa. It rains about every other day and the average rainfall is high at about 9 in (240 mm).

Packed with white-sand beaches and water sports, Okinawa is a popular destination for summer vacations. You could enjoy exciting activities, such as snorkeling/diving in the caves, swimming with sea turtles, and surfing.

Festival: The Okinawa All-Island Eisa Festival is usually held in late August and is one of the big celebrations in summer. You could better understand the culture of Okinawa by witnessing performances with traditional drums and other instruments, alongside unique dancing.

【49† 】 

【49†12-Day Tokyo, Okinawa, Osaka, Kyoto and Nara Tour】

## Costs and Crowding in August

August in Japan is one of the most popular times to travel, especially for families with school-age children. You may see crowds in many sightseeing spots.

Due to the high demand, the cost of hotels and international flights might be about 10% more expensive than usual.

We suggest that you book at least 3 months in advance to guarantee your favorite rooms and professional guides. Our Japanese travel advisor would 【42†create a wonderful trip】 based on your interests.

Get more ideas about【50† How Much Is a Trip to Japan】>>>

## What Should I Wear in August?

Because of the hot weather, summer clothing with breathable fabrics is advisable, such as short-sleeved shirts, dresses, shorts, and sandals.

Sun protection is a must due to the high UV rays on sunny days, so pack your sunscreen, hat, and sunglasses.

You're also advised to take some insect repellent as mosquito numbers peak in summer.

In August, Tokyo experiences hot and humid weather, with average daytime temperatures around 31°C (88°F) and nighttime temperatures around 25°C (77°F). The high humidity can make it feel even warmer, with a heat index that can reach up to 39°C (102°F)【7†source】【8†source】.

Rainfall is relatively common, with about 16 days of rain and an average precipitation of 147 mm (5.8 inches) throughout the month【6†source】【8†source】. August also sees the highest sea temperatures of the year, making it a good time for coastal activities, with water temperatures averaging around 25.7°C (78.3°F)【8†source】.

For those planning outdoor activities, it's important to note that Tokyo also has around 10.3 hours of sunshine per day, providing plenty of daylight despite the occasional rain【9†source】. Be prepared for the possibility of tropical storms, which can affect the region for about 1.8 days in August【7†source】.

If you're traveling to Tokyo in August, it's advisable to wear lightweight, breathable clothing and ensure you have adequate sun protection and hydration【10†source】.

Daytime temperatures usually reach 31°C in Tokyo in August with high heat and humidity, falling to 24°C at night. 

### How sunny is it in Tokyo in August?

There are normally 6 hours of bright sunshine each day in Tokyo in August - that's 43% of daylight hours. 

### How warm is the sea around Tokyo in August?

The average sea temperature around Tokyo in August is 26°C.

### Does it rain in Tokyo in August?

There are usually 16 days with some rain in Tokyo in August and the average monthly rainfall is 147mm. 

### What is the chance of a typhoon in Tokyo in August?

On average 1.8 days in August in Tokyo are likely to be affected by the passage of one or more tropical storms.

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the warmest month in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the peak temperatures are generally noted in August, averaging a high of 31°C (87.8°F) and a low of 25.1°C (77.2°F).

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

In Tokyo, 31°C (87.8°F) is the average high-temperature and 25.1°C (77.2°F) is the average low-temperature during August. The average heat index (a.k.a. 'feels like', 'real feel'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is appraised at 39°C (102.2°F).

### What is the average humidity in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the average relative humidity in August is 73%.

### How many days does it rain in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, it is raining for 9.7 days, with typically 26mm (1.02") of accumulated precipitation.

### When it does not snow in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, snow does not fall in April through December.

### What is the month with the warmest sea water in Tokyo?

August is the month with the warmest seawater in Tokyo, with an average sea temperature of 25.7°C (78.3°F).

### What is the water temperature in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, the average water temperature is 25.7°C (78.3°F). For swimming, diving, and other water activities, temperatures between 25°C (77°F) and 29°C (84.2°F) are perceived as very enjoyable and pleasurable for prolonged periods without feeling uncomfortable.

### What is the average length of the day in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average day length in August is 13h and 29min.

### When are sunrise and sunset in August in Tokyo?

In August, on the first day of the month, sunrise is at 04:49 and sunset at 18:45. On the last day of the month, in Tokyo, sunrise is at 05:12 and sunset at 18:10 JST.

### What month has the most sunshine in Tokyo?

With an average of 10.3h of sunshine, August has the most sunshine of the year in Tokyo, Japan.

### How many hours of sunshine does Tokyo have in August?

The average sunshine duration in August in Tokyo is 10.3h.

### What is the UV index reading in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average daily maximum UV index in August is 6. A UV Index value of 6 to 7 symbolizes a high health vulnerability from unsafe exposure to Sun's UV rays.

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the warmest month in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the peak temperatures are generally noted in August, averaging a high of 31°C (87.8°F) and a low of 25.1°C (77.2°F).

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

In Tokyo, 31°C (87.8°F) is the average high-temperature and 25.1°C (77.2°F) is the average low-temperature during August. The average heat index (a.k.a. 'feels like', 'real feel'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is appraised at 39°C (102.2°F).

### What is the average humidity in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the average relative humidity in August is 73%.

### How many days does it rain in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, it is raining for 9.7 days, with typically 26mm (1.02") of accumulated precipitation.

### When it does not snow in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, snow does not fall in April through December.

### What is the month with the warmest sea water in Tokyo?

August is the month with the warmest seawater in Tokyo, with an average sea temperature of 25.7°C (78.3°F).

### What is the water temperature in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, the average water temperature is 25.7°C (78.3°F). For swimming, diving, and other water activities, temperatures between 25°C (77°F) and 29°C (84.2°F) are perceived as very enjoyable and pleasurable for prolonged periods without feeling uncomfortable.

### What is the average length of the day in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average day length in August is 13h and 29min.

### When are sunrise and sunset in August in Tokyo?

In August, on the first day of the month, sunrise is at 04:49 and sunset at 18:45. On the last day of the month, in Tokyo, sunrise is at 05:12 and sunset at 18:10 JST.

### What month has the most sunshine in Tokyo?

With an average of 10.3h of sunshine, August has the most sunshine of the year in Tokyo, Japan.

### How many hours of sunshine does Tokyo have in August?

The average sunshine duration in August in Tokyo is 10.3h.

### What is the UV index reading in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average daily maximum UV index in August is 6. A UV Index value of 6 to 7 symbolizes a high health vulnerability from unsafe exposure to Sun's UV rays.

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

Daytime temperatures usually reach 31°C in Tokyo in August with high heat and humidity, falling to 24°C at night. 

### How sunny is it in Tokyo in August?

There are normally 6 hours of bright sunshine each day in Tokyo in August - that's 43% of daylight hours. 

### How warm is the sea around Tokyo in August?

The average sea temperature around Tokyo in August is 26°C.

### Does it rain in Tokyo in August?

There are usually 16 days with some rain in Tokyo in August and the average monthly rainfall is 147mm. 

### What is the chance of a typhoon in Tokyo in August?

On average 1.8 days in August in Tokyo are likely to be affected by the passage of one or more tropical storms.

metadata.title: Japan Weather in August 2024: Travel Tips for First Visit
metadata.text:
Festivals: August in Japan is the perfect time to experience culture-rich festival celebrations and grand fireworks displays. Don't miss the chance to immerse yourself in the huge parades, traditional dance performances, and colorful fireworks.

  * The Jingu Gaien Fireworks Festival in Tokyo (mid-August in 2024)
  * The Obon Festival in Kyoto (August 13 to 16, 2024)
  * The Yodogawa Fireworks Festival in Osaka (August 3, 2024)

Suggest reading: 【32†Plan a Family Trip to Japan 】>>>

【43† 】 

【43†9-Day Japan Highlights Tour Tokyo - Hakone - Kyoto - Osaka 】

## Hokkaido and Northern Japan in August: Summer Retreats

  * Sapporo, Otaru, and Noboribetsu

With its higher latitudes, you could enjoy cooler weather and more-bearable humidity in northern Japan than in central and southern Japan. The average high is 77°F (25°C).

In late August, Hokkaido receives its heaviest rainfall, averaging 5 in (127 mm) for the month. If you're looking for outdoor adventures, such as hiking in the national parks, early August should be a better time.

August is also the best time to spot wildlife from a sightseeing boat, such as brown bears, whales, and a variety of birds.

Festival: The Noboribetsu Hell Festival is held in Hell Valley (Jidokudai) on the last Saturday in August every year in Noboribetsu. You would see locals playing the drums and performing traditional dances in the grand parade.

Here are some popular travel lengths in Japan for your inspiration: 【44†7 days】, 【45†10 days】, 【46†12 days】, and 【47†14 days】.

【48† 】 

【48†8-Day Hokkaido Summer Vacation — Nature & Traditions】

## Okinawa in Southern Japan in August: Best for Water Sports

  * Naha

In August, average daily temperatures range from 81°F (27°C) to 88°F (31°C ) in Okinawa. It rains about every other day and the average rainfall is high at about 9 in (240 mm).

Packed with white-sand beaches and water sports, Okinawa is a popular destination for summer vacations. You could enjoy exciting activities, such as snorkeling/diving in the caves, swimming with sea turtles, and surfing.

Festival: The Okinawa All-Island Eisa Festival is usually held in late August and is one of the big celebrations in summer. You could better understand the culture of Okinawa by witnessing performances with traditional drums and other instruments, alongside unique dancing.

【49† 】 

【49†12-Day Tokyo, Okinawa, Osaka, Kyoto and Nara Tour】

## Costs and Crowding in August

August in Japan is one of the most popular times to travel, especially for families with school-age children. You may see crowds in many sightseeing spots.

Due to the high demand, the cost of hotels and international flights might be about 10% more expensive than usual.

We suggest that you book at least 3 months in advance to guarantee your favorite rooms and professional guides. Our Japanese travel advisor would 【42†create a wonderful trip】 based on your interests.

Get more ideas about【50† How Much Is a Trip to Japan】>>>

## What Should I Wear in August?

Because of the hot weather, summer clothing with breathable fabrics is advisable, such as short-sleeved shirts, dresses, shorts, and sandals.

Sun protection is a must due to the high UV rays on sunny days, so pack your sunscreen, hat, and sunglasses.

You're also advised to take some insect repellent as mosquito numbers peak in summer.

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the warmest month in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the peak temperatures are generally noted in August, averaging a high of 31°C (87.8°F) and a low of 25.1°C (77.2°F).

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

In Tokyo, 31°C (87.8°F) is the average high-temperature and 25.1°C (77.2°F) is the average low-temperature during August. The average heat index (a.k.a. 'feels like', 'real feel'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is appraised at 39°C (102.2°F).

### What is the average humidity in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, the average relative humidity in August is 73%.

### How many days does it rain in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, it is raining for 9.7 days, with typically 26mm (1.02") of accumulated precipitation.

### When it does not snow in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, snow does not fall in April through December.

### What is the month with the warmest sea water in Tokyo?

August is the month with the warmest seawater in Tokyo, with an average sea temperature of 25.7°C (78.3°F).

### What is the water temperature in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, Japan, in August, the average water temperature is 25.7°C (78.3°F). For swimming, diving, and other water activities, temperatures between 25°C (77°F) and 29°C (84.2°F) are perceived as very enjoyable and pleasurable for prolonged periods without feeling uncomfortable.

### What is the average length of the day in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average day length in August is 13h and 29min.

### When are sunrise and sunset in August in Tokyo?

In August, on the first day of the month, sunrise is at 04:49 and sunset at 18:45. On the last day of the month, in Tokyo, sunrise is at 05:12 and sunset at 18:10 JST.

### What month has the most sunshine in Tokyo?

With an average of 10.3h of sunshine, August has the most sunshine of the year in Tokyo, Japan.

### How many hours of sunshine does Tokyo have in August?

The average sunshine duration in August in Tokyo is 10.3h.

### What is the UV index reading in August in Tokyo?

In Tokyo, the average daily maximum UV index in August is 6. A UV Index value of 6 to 7 symbolizes a high health vulnerability from unsafe exposure to Sun's UV rays.

### How hot is it in Tokyo in August?

Daytime temperatures usually reach 31°C in Tokyo in August with high heat and humidity, falling to 24°C at night. 

### How sunny is it in Tokyo in August?

There are normally 6 hours of bright sunshine each day in Tokyo in August - that's 43% of daylight hours. 

### How warm is the sea around Tokyo in August?

The average sea temperature around Tokyo in August is 26°C.

### Does it rain in Tokyo in August?

There are usually 16 days with some rain in Tokyo in August and the average monthly rainfall is 147mm. 

### What is the chance of a typhoon in Tokyo in August?

On average 1.8 days in August in Tokyo are likely to be affected by the passage of one or more tropical storms.

content_references.snippet:
Festivals: August in Japan is the perfect time to experience culture-rich festival celebrations and grand fireworks displays. Don't miss the chance to immerse yourself in the huge parades, traditional dance performances, and colorful fireworks.

  * The Jingu Gaien Fireworks Festival in Tokyo (mid-August in 2024)
  * The Obon Festival in Kyoto (August 13 to 16, 2024)
  * The Yodogawa Fireworks Festival in Osaka (August 3, 2024)

Suggest reading: 【32†Plan a Family Trip to Japan 】>>>

【43† 】 

【43†9-Day Japan Highlights Tour Tokyo - Hakone - Kyoto - Osaka 】

## Hokkaido and Northern Japan in August: Summer Retreats

  * Sapporo, Otaru, and Noboribetsu

With its higher latitudes, you could enjoy cooler weather and more-bearable humidity in northern Japan than in central and southern Japan. The average high is 77°F (25°C).

In late August, Hokkaido receives its heaviest rainfall, averaging 5 in (127 mm) for the month. If you're looking for outdoor adventures, such as hiking in the national parks, early August should be a better time.

August is also the best time to spot wildlife from a sightseeing boat, such as brown bears, whales, and a variety of birds.

Festival: The Noboribetsu Hell Festival is held in Hell Valley (Jidokudai) on the last Saturday in August every year in Noboribetsu. You would see locals playing the drums and performing traditional dances in the grand parade.

Here are some popular travel lengths in Japan for your inspiration: 【44†7 days】, 【45†10 days】, 【46†12 days】, and 【47†14 days】.

【48† 】 

【48†8-Day Hokkaido Summer Vacation — Nature & Traditions】

## Okinawa in Southern Japan in August: Best for Water Sports

  * Naha

In August, average daily temperatures range from 81°F (27°C) to 88°F (31°C ) in Okinawa. It rains about every other day and the average rainfall is high at about 9 in (240 mm).

Packed with white-sand beaches and water sports, Okinawa is a popular destination for summer vacations. You could enjoy exciting activities, such as snorkeling/diving in the caves, swimming with sea turtles, and surfing.

Festival: The Okinawa All-Island Eisa Festival is usually held in late August and is one of the big celebrations in summer. You could better understand the culture of Okinawa by witnessing performances with traditional drums and other instruments, alongside unique dancing.

## Costs and Crowding in August

August in Japan is one of the most popular times to travel, especially for families with school-age children. You may see crowds in many sightseeing spots.

Due to the high demand, the cost of hotels and international flights might be about 10% more expensive than usual.

We suggest that you book at least 3 months in advance to guarantee your favorite rooms and professional guides. Our Japanese travel advisor would 【42†create a wonderful trip】 based on your interests.

Get more ideas about【50† How Much Is a Trip to Japan】>>>

## What Should I Wear in August?

Because of the hot weather, summer clothing with breathable fabrics is advisable, such as short-sleeved shirts, dresses, shorts, and sandals.

Sun protection is a must due to the high UV rays on sunny days, so pack your sunscreen, hat, and sunglasses.

You're also advised to take some insect repellent as mosquito numbers peak in summer.
